author: James Taylor
title: Cherbourg to receive $26 million for upgrades to contaminated water supply - ABC News
text: The First Nations community of Cherbourg will receive $26 million to upgrade its water infrastructure. The local council hopes the upgrade will put an end to frequent "boil water" alerts. What's next? The council expects the new water treatment plant to be operational within two to three years. The residents of Cherbourg are finally getting a secure water supply that will make a major difference to their health and lives. Alerts advising residents to boil their water have been a frequent occurrence for the First Nations settlement three hours' drive from Brisbane, known as one of Australia's most disadvantaged communities. The most recent episode extended nine months until July 2024, due to a muddy water supply containing E. coli bacteria, fed directly from a nearby creek. According to a 2022 risk management report, water runoff from nearby cattle grazing land contained a "significant load" of viruses and bacteria, with mining operations from a nearby lime quarry also posing a risk to the water supply. Cherbourg Shire Council staff said the 70-year-old water treatment plant should have been upgraded decades ago in order to keep pace with population growth and more intensive agriculture. "It's probably the last 20 to 25 years that we haven't been making a high enough quality of water to be the standard with the rest of Queensland," operations manager Matthew Boch said. 'Sometimes we have to hit rock bottom' Queensland Water Minister Glenn Butcher this week announced $26 million in joint funding from the state and federal governments to fix the problem, including improvements to the water mains, filtration equipment and water treatment processes. Mr Butcher said the funding was locked in and was not dependent on the outcome of October's Queensland election. "It will certainly give them the best water-drinking quality they can get," Mr Butcher said. "As we know, some of these remote regions need that extra support with extra filtration and extra upgrades for water treatment facilities — that's what this funding is going to do." Mr Boch said he expected construction to begin in June 2025, with the new infrastructure operational within two to three years. Cherbourg Shire Council chief executive Chatur Zala said the funding announcement was a welcome outcome after protracted negotiations with the state and federal governments. "Sometimes we have to hit rock bottom for them to see things are not really working," he said. "We'll do everything to ensure we don't go back to the boil water alerts, because no-one likes them." 'Why do we have to wait and wait and wait?' Residents have linked the substandard water supply with Cherbourg's deep health disadvantage. Australian Bureau of Statistics data shows the community has more than twice the rate of long-term health conditions such as diabetes and kidney disease than the rest of the state. Workers caring for the most vulnerable in the community long ago eschewed the town's water supply, opting instead to buy bottled water. Aunty Jacqui Tapua, who is director of the community-run Gundoo Early Childhood Centre, said the centre paid about $600 per month for bottled water. But she said outbreaks of diarrhoea, gastroenteritis and rotaviruses were common for children who drank the town water at home. "We're not that remote that our water quality [should be] so poor that our children suffer, our elders suffer," she said. Aunty Tapua said long delays in bringing the water supply up to standard were a clear example of the inequitable treatment of First Nations communities in Cherbourg. "If it was a non-Indigenous community, I think the problem would be solved," she said. "Sometimes we feel like, 'Why do we have to wait and wait and wait.'" Despite being let down by announcements of past initiatives, Aunty Tapua was cautiously optimistic the new funding would result in a water supply that would meet the expectations of all Australians. "I think we hear too often, 'We're fixing it,'" she said. "Hopefully they'll do it right this time, for the future of the children of our community." ABC Wide Bay — local news in your inbox ABC Privacy Collection Statement .

author: NewIndianXpress
title: Ram temple inauguration: Not interested in event, Yechury replies to Misra
text:
Ram temple inauguration: Not interested in event, Yechury replies to Misra
In 2020, Yechury criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for laying the foundation stone of Ram Temple at Ayodhya saying that it was a violation of the Constitution in letter and spirit.
Published: 24th December 2023 11:27 AM | Last Updated: 24th December 2023 11:30 AM | A+A A-
NEW DELHI: CPI (M) general Secretary Sitaram Yechury has turned down the invitation to attend the
consecration ceremony of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya which will take place on January 22, 2024. Nripendra Misra, Chairman of the Ayodhya Ram Mandir Construction Committee invited Yechury for the consecration ceremony. In 2019, after the Supreme Court ruled in favour of the construction of Ram temple at the disputed site, the CPM said that the Ayodhya judgment had given precedence to the ‘faith and beliefs of one side’ and said that a verdict had been delivered but it was not justice.
In 2020, Yechury criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for laying the foundation stone of Ram Temple at Ayodhya saying that it was a violation of the Constitution in letter and spirit.
The committee has extended invitations to opposition leaders including Sonia Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge, former PM Manmohan Singh, and NCP chief Sharad Pawar, among others. Though, the Congress thanked the Ram Janmabhoomi Trust for the invitation, it has not yet made clear its stand on whether its top leaders will be attending the ceremony.
Congress general secretary (organization) KC Venugopal on Thursday said that the leaders have received an invitation to the ceremony. “They have invited us, we are very much thankful to them for inviting us, let us see”, he said on the sidelines of the Congress Working Committee meeting.
When asked whether top leaders would attend the ceremony, Venugopal said, “You will know about the party’s stand.” Earlier, senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said that Sonia Gandhi was ‘very positive on this matter’, referring to the invitation. Singh said that either Gandhi or a delegation from her side would attend the ceremony.
When asked if he had received any invitation to the grand ceremony, Singh said, “The BJP will not invite me because they are not inviting the true devotees. Whether it be Murli Manohar Joshi, L K Advani or Digvijay Singh, they will not be given the invitation,” he said.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 创业板ETF博时（159908）跌1.16%，成交额5712.61万元|创业板_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
8月14日，博时创业板ETF（159908）收盘跌1.16%，成交额5712.61万元。
创业板ETF博时（159908）成立于2011年6月10日，基金全称为博时创业板交易型开放式指数证券投资基金，基金简称为博时创业板ETF。该基金管理费率每年0.15%，托管费率每年0.05%。创业板ETF博时（159908）业绩比较基准为 创业板指数 收益率。
规模方面，截止8月13日，创业板ETF博时（159908）最新份额为6.82亿份，最新规模为15.82亿元。回顾2024年12月31日，创业板ETF博时（159908）份额为10.82亿份，规模为21.33亿元。即该基金今年以来份额减少36.96%，规模减少25.83%。
流动性方面，截止8月14日，创业板ETF博时（159908）近20个交易日累计成交金额5.30亿元，日均成交金额2648.64万元；今年以来，150个交易日，累计成交金额22.77亿元，日均成交金额1518.13万元。
创业板ETF博时（159908）现任基金经理为尹浩。尹浩自2019年10月11日管理（或拟管理）该基金，任职期内收益61.17%。
最新定期报告显示，创业板ETF博时（159908）重仓股包括 宁德时代 、 东方财富 、 汇川技术 、 中际旭创 、 迈瑞医疗 、 新易盛 、 阳光电源 、 温氏股份 、 胜宏科技 、 亿纬锂能 ，持仓占比如下。 股票代码 股票名称 持仓占比 持仓股数（股） 持仓市值（元） 300750 宁德时代 18.68% 155.27万 3.92亿 300059 东方财富 8.34% 755.61万 1.75亿 300124 汇川技术 3.69% 119.66万 7726.48万 300308 中际旭创 3.63% 52.19万 7612.91万 300760 迈瑞医疗 3.56% 33.18万 7457.61万 300502 新易盛 3.21% 53.06万 6740.19万 300274 阳光电源 2.85% 88.22万 5978.94万 300498 温氏股份 2.62% 321.71万 5494.77万 300476 胜宏科技 2.36% 36.84万 4950.56万 300014 亿纬锂能 1.67% 76.26万 3493.36万

author: @infoitinterno
title: Riforma del patto di stabilità e manovra economica: le parole di Giorgetti
text: [ ](https://www.informazione.it/a/DFC461B1-6256-4887-8280-D08E622BCA22/Manovra-2024-oggi-alla-Camera-il-voto-finale-tutte-le-novita-Accordo-in-Cdm-su-Superbonus-e-via-libera-alla-riforma-dell-Irpef-news-in-diretta) Manovra 2024, oggi alla Camera il voto finale: tutte le novità. Accordo in Cdm su Superbonus e via libera alla riforma dell’Irpef, news in diretta [Leggi](https://www.fanpage.it/live/manovra-2024-oggi-lapprovazione-alla-camera-tutte-le-novita-accordo-in-cdm-su-superbonus-news-in-diretta/) Giancarlo Giorgetti, ministro dell'Economia, ha recentemente discusso la riforma del Patto di Stabilità e la manovra economica. Ha sottolineato la necessità di assumersi la responsabilità delle decisioni prese, affermando che ha accettato un accordo piuttosto che mettere un veto a caso per tornare a regole peggiori. Giorgetti ha espresso la sua preoccupazione per l'illusione che negli ultimi quattro anni si potesse continuare a fare debito e deficit senza tornare a un sistema di regole. Ha sottolineato che questa discussione è viziata da tale illusione. Il ministro dell'Economia ha anche parlato dello sforzo a favore di imprese e famiglie nella manovra, che secondo lui produrrà una crescita del Pil pari alle aspettative del governo. Ha riconosciuto che queste aspettative eccedono rispetto alle stime aggiornate, un fenomeno che si verifica in tutti i Paesi europei a causa della guerra in corso e delle sue ripercussioni finanziarie. Giorgetti ha poi parlato dell'inflazione, che ha definito "questa sconosciuta", tornata a falcidiare i redditi delle famiglie europee e a condizionare il commercio globale e la crescita in Europa. Ha anche menzionato la recessione in Germania, che ha influenzato la crescita economica dell'Italia. Infine, Giorgetti ha affermato che la manovra ha subito una serie di cambiamenti in Senato, tenendo conto del profilo di spendibilità. Questi cambiamenti hanno portato a un miglioramento di tutti i saldi di finanza pubblica.

author: Sivan2500
title: Sky to replace thousands of call centre workers with chatbots
text:
Sky logo Sky is cutting 2,000 call centre staff and replacing them with chatbots, saying people are tired of phoning customer service agents.
The broadcaster will close three of its 10 customer service centres in Stockport, Sheffield and Leeds as it cuts 7pc of its workforce.
Instead, it will invest more in round-the-clock online chat representatives – who will be based overseas – as well as artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots.
Sky claimed that the majority of customers now wanted to handle tasks like renewing contracts and paying bills through its app and website rather than over the phone.
The company, which is owned by the US media conglomerate Comcast, said it expected to receive millions fewer calls from customers in the coming years, with annual volumes dropping from 25m to 17m by 2029.
Sky is swinging the axe as it battles heavy losses and tries to navigate the switch from lucrative satellite contracts to the more competitive streaming landscape.
The broadcaster reported a £773m loss for 2023, its most recent set of accounts, largely due to write-downs in its Italian and German businesses. Its expenses rose as it paid out more for football rights.
It comes after it emerged that Sky is cutting around 1,000 jobs, including installation engineers, as more people access its TV services over the internet rather than through satellite dishes.
The changes are potentially risky given Sky has long had a reputation for good customer service. Ofcom figures show it is the least complained-about telecoms provider in the UK.
Sky said it would continue to have thousands of phone advisers, and that it would invest millions in its Livingston campus in Scotland, including a “centre of excellence”.
It said the decision came after surveying 10,000 customers, and finding that nine in 10 wanted to be able to contact the company in more ways than over the phone.
A Sky spokesman said: “We’re transforming our business to deliver quicker, simpler and more digital customer service.
“Our customers increasingly want choice, to speak to us on the phone when they need us most and the ease of managing everyday tasks digitally.
“We’re investing in a new centre of excellence for customer service, alongside cutting-edge digital technology to make our service seamless, reliable and available 24/7. This is about building a future-ready Sky that continues to put our customers and their needs first.”
BT has also said that it expects to replace thousands of customer service workers with AI.
NatWest said last week it would use technology from OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT, to develop a digital assistant for customers.

Strategies for Successful Online video Conferencing
one) Make use of a significant-excellent webcam
For productive movie conferencing, a substantial-excellent webcam is a necessity. Grainy, fuzzy, and distorted audio are Repeated results of small-high-quality cameras. Look at the digicam angle to validate that everybody is often witnessed inside the body. In advance of expending dollars on the digicam, it’s critical to take into account variables like latency, connection, and product compatibility. It might aid to have a digicam that gives the best attainable audio and Visible knowledge with out latencies or freezing. Buying a high quality webcam can go a great distance in making sure productive online video conferencing.
two) Invest in fantastic lights
Great lights is important for successful movie conferencing. Should the lighting is inadequate, the online video may possibly glance grainy, that will ensure it is tough to the members to interact and deal with the content material. Invest in lighting designed for online video conferencing, like ring lights or softboxes. These lights can help produce a delicate, even gentle that gained’t be way too harsh or dazzling. Evaluate the sizing and placement of The sunshine meticulously – it should really deliver more than enough illumination whilst even now allowing for you to move across the area without having casting shadows. All-natural light-weight can even be a fantastic choice, but make sure to Look at the Sunlight isn’t instantly hitting the digicam and washing out your online video.
3) Go with a peaceful
Decide on a peaceful put right before starting your movie conference to be sure undisturbed interaction. Track record noises may perhaps distract the participants from participating inside a free-move mode of interaction, interrupting the move with the meeting.
You need to intention to pick a place to eliminate any probable noises that might interfere with the decision. Obtain a little room having a closed window or a home Place of work with a lot less distraction. You may also pick out an out of doors Area, like a patio or balcony, to reduce outside sounds.
four) Build your digicam at eye level
It is essential to set your digicam at eye amount for a far better see throughout video clip conferencing.
check here This might make a huge big difference in how you come across on screen and allows to make a much more all-natural, partaking conversation. Finally, make sure the lights is good. All-natural mild could be flattering, but severe overhead lights can Solid shadows and develop an unflattering impact. For anyone who is sitting down in front of the window, hold the light streaming on you for making oneself apparent and visual on the individuals over the video.
five) Examination your audio and video clip before the meeting
When joining a online video conference, you need to guarantee your audio and movie are Performing adequately. This will guarantee Every person inside the
video conferencing Conference can listen to and find out you.
To check In the event your audio and movie function thoroughly, it is best to check them ahead of the meeting starts off. You may join a take a look at contact with on your own or a pal.
In the examination connect with, make sure your microphone is effective correctly plus the seem will come by means of Evidently. You should also Examine the caliber of your video clip feed and make sure your camera focuses on you appropriately.
It is possible to confidently be part of the Conference as you’ve analyzed your audio and online video. Ensuring that your audio and movie get the job done prior to the Assembly may help prevent any embarrassing specialized issues throughout the get in touch with. Verify your tools periodically to make certain that the meeting goes smoothly.
six) Mute your microphone after you’re not speaking
Whenever you’re not Talking for the duration of a video meeting, it’s crucial that you silence your microphone to maintain a successful setting. This allows others to talk without interruption from qualifications noise. What's more, it prevents responses out of your microphone when other contributors are speaking.
To be sure Everybody is often heard Obviously, all members should follow this etiquette and make sure to mute their microphones once they’re not actively participating in the dialogue. To really make it simpler for persons to remember, contemplate making a sign or reminder that reminds them to mute if they’re not talking.
This can be carried out by way of uncomplicated hand alerts or by setting up an automated reminder message that plays every time someone joins the decision. Finding the time to carry out these practices will help create an efficient and productive Digital Assembly setting.
7) Pay attention to body language
Body language is usually equally as critical as verbal communication regarding online video conferencing. So that you can retain conversations flowing effortlessly, members need to pay attention to refined cues for example human body language.
Make frequent eye connection with the camera (or the individual you're Chatting with) when communicating by video clip. Sit up straight, manage very good posture, and preserve superior posture when communicating by video. This could present that you'll be engaged inside the dialogue and cause you to appear far more self-assured. Furthermore, endeavor to smile and use other facial expressions to point out interest.
Gestures and hand movements also can emphasize your words and phrases and help preserve discussions attention-grabbing. Nonetheless, overdoing People actions is likely to be distracting. Consequently, it is better to Restrict yourself Using the gesturing.
Conclusion
The electronic age has made video conferencing important for corporations and private use. It is important to employ this know-how proficiently to help keep up with the current occasions. author: Investing.com
title: Jefferies sees another positive year for software stocks, raises Dynatrace and Monday.com - Investing.com India
text:
Analysts at Jefferies provided their view on the software sector in a recent research note, upgrading Dynatrace Inc. (NYSE: DT ), monday.com Ltd. (MNDY (NASDAQ: MNDY )), Freshworks Inc (FRSH), and Instructure (INST) to Buy. They also downgraded Okta, Inc. (NASDAQ: OKTA ) and Vimeo (NASDAQ: VMEO ) to Hold.
Overall, Jefferies expects 2024 to be another positive year for the sector, though they feel we will likely see more measured returns.
"1H could be challenging given 4Q23 rally and seasonal Q1 black ice," said the firm, adding it would, however, position selectively for a better second half of the year, driven by fundamental acceleration, increased adoption of AI SKUs, lower interest rates, still reasonable valuation, and potential M&A pick-up.
Focusing on the upgrades, Jefferies said it lifted DT as it sees an attractive setup for the stock in F2H24 and FY25, underappreciated upside to ARR driven by emerging products made possible by efficiencies of Grail, and a large install base that they believe is underpenetrated and should benefit from further investments in GTM and the adoption of DPS. The DT price target was raised to $70 from $50 per share.
The financial services firm said they see MNDY as a long-term winner in the collaboration software space with "the best momentum in both topline growth and FCF margins." They also said its valuation is attractive as it trades at a significant discount to high-growth software peers. MNDY's price target was lifted to $230 from $180.
For FRSH, Jefferies said there are five reasons for the upgrade: Its important metrics are close to hitting a bottom, it still has room for cost savings, the company is "playing offense on AI," it has better GTM execution, and it is "getting back to the rule of 40." Jefferies raised the FRSH price target to $30 from $20.
INST has been lifted to Buy as the firm favors B2B education tech vendors over B2C. "We continue to prefer the B2B education tech space over the B2C space given end market stability and clearer medium-term growth outlooks," said Jefferies. INST's price target was increased to $30 from $25.
"High gross retention rates (in the mid 90% range) and built-in annual price increases (3%-5%) help to support predictable and durable low-double-digit revenue growth," they added. "INST's B2B exposure and focus on K-12 and higher-ed should allow INST to execute against its goals, irrespective of the macro environment."
When it comes to downgrades, OKTA was moved to Hold as the stock has hit Jefferies' $85 price target. It was assigned a new $95 per share price target. "We view our $95 PT, or 6x EV/CY25 rev, as appropriate, particularly given the execution risk associated with the recent worse-than-expected cyber incident," said the firm.
Vimeo's unclear growth outlook and recent C-suite changes have resulted in Jefferies putting a "pause on the story" despite what they view as an attractive valuation. "As part of our 2024 outlook, we are downgrading shares of VMEO to Hold until we can gain line of sight into a durable revenue growth recovery," wrote the firm. The new VMEO price target is $, down from $7 per share.

author: John
title: Republican primaries, Trump wins by a landslide in Iowa: “And now let’s take America back”
text:
Donald Trump wins the first stage of the Republican primaries in Iowa by a landslide, in less than half an hour from the opening of the caucuses, with just over 50% of the votes and a record gap of around 30 points, more than double Bob Dole’s record in 1988. According to the partial results of the Iowa caucuses, out of the state’s 40 delegates for the Republican convention, Donald Trump gets 20, Ron DeSantis 8 and Nikky Haley 7. CNN reports it.
The tycoon has made waves in all social areas, starting with the evangelicals, with the only weakness of the suburban areas. An astonishing result if you consider that in 2016 he came second here and that since then he has sown chaos, suffered two impeachments and is awaiting four criminal trials, including two for attempting to subvert the outcome of the vote. During the night, however, it was a long head-to-head between his main challengers for second place, won by Ron DeSantis against Nikky Haley, contrary to predictions.
But the gap is so low (21.2% to 19%, with 94% of the votes counted) that it does not make a substantial difference, leaving the race open as to which of the two will be able to try to present itself as an alternative to The Donald: in the next stop on January 23rd in the more liberal New Hampshire, the former UN ambassador is better positioned. On the other hand, the tech entrepreneur of Indian origins Vivek Ramaswamy (fourth with 7.7%) withdraws, giving his endorsement to former president Trump, increasing his number of votes.
“I am honored and invigorated by this victory”, the tycoon’s first comment on Fox, before his official speech. Starting on a conciliatory tone with the hope of uniting the country in a bipartisan way, congratulations to DeSantis-Haley and praise from her family, including her recently deceased mother-in-law. But he immediately turned to attacks on Joe Biden, “the worst president in US history” and the director of his trials (“election interference”). Or in the threatening promise to “seal the border with Mexico against the invasion of criminals and terrorists”, implementing “a system of deportations not seen in this country since the days of Eisenhower”. Biden acknowledged that after Iowa Trump “is the favorite for the Republican nomination” and his campaign warned that if he wins there will be “vile attacks, endless lies and massive spending.”
